intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. bugeysiense, commonly known as the Bugeysian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant features a rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow composite flowers. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
